We are looking for a highly experienced refractory professional to lead refractory planning, installation, maintenance, and performance optimization across Steel Melt Shop units, including EAF, LRF, ladles, and tundish systems. The role focuses on extending refractory campaign life, ensuring production continuity, reducing refractory cost per ton, and maintaining safe and reliable furnace operations through structured monitoring and technical control. Job Responsibilities: Manage refractory systems for EAF, LRF, ladles, tundish, and auxiliary units by planning lining cycles, repairs, and shutdown jobs to ensure continuous and safe SMS operation. Plan refractory lining and relining campaigns by analyzing consumption history and furnace performance data to extend lining life and minimize unplanned downtime. Diagnose illnesses, develop treatment plans, and prescribe medications in accordance with established protocols and guidelines. Responsibilities & Context Job Context: Dhaka Ahsania Mission (DAM) is a non-government development organization founded in 1958 by Khan Bahadur Ahsanullah, an eminent educationist, reformer and Sufi with the aim of social and spiritual development of entire human community. DAM has been contributing for the betterment of the disadvantaged population through operating 35 institutions and also 8 sectors of development. Health Sector is one of the core sectors of DAMwhich has also been operating 8 institutions and 11 projects. Responsibilities & Context Job Purpose The Executive / Senior Executive – Payroll is responsible for managing and executing the full spectrum of payroll operations at the hospital. This includes ensuring accuracy, timeliness, confidentiality, and compliance with labor laws, hospital policies, and statutory requirements. In addition, the role requires managing employee final settlements, long-term/short-term benefits (Festival Bonus, Profit Incentive, Provident Fund, Gratuity, Welfare Fund, etc.), and preparing reports on payroll analytics and metrics. Duties & Responsibilities Payroll Processing Prepare and process monthly payroll for all hospital employees, including doctors, nurses, medical staff, administrative, and support staff. Calculate salary, overtime, duty allowance, night allowance, incentives, bonuses, arrears, and deductions accurately. Ensure payroll adjustments related to leave, attendance, late marks, absence, and shift duties. Coordinate with Accounts/Finance for salary disbursement through bank transfer. Attendance & Data Management Collect, verify, and update attendance, leave, roster, and duty information from concerned departments. Maintain and update employee payroll data related to joining, confirmation, increment, promotion, transfer, resignation, and termination. Statutory Compliance Ensure payroll compliance with Bangladesh Labor Act and hospital HR policies. Manage statutory deductions such as Provident Fund, Gratuity, Income Tax, loans, and advances. Prepare salary certificates, tax statements, and support annual tax return documentation when required. Employee Final Settlement & Long-term Benefits Handle employee final settlements, including full and final payment, tax, and benefits calculation for resignations, retirements, and terminations. job_description: Manager - Business Data Analyst (Health, EHR & Donor Reporting) : Shakti Foundation for Disadvantaged Women. Jobs ENG বাংলা Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Shakti Foundation for Disadvantaged Women. Manager - Business Data Analyst (Health, EHR & Donor Reporting) Application Deadline : 06 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 01 Location: Dhaka (Mirpur) Salary: Tk. 35000 - 40000 (Monthly) Published: 07 Jan 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements More than 3 years of relevant experience in health data analysis, EHR systems, or donor-funded health programs Demonstrated experience in donor reporting, preferably with DFAT, OIA, or similar development partners Strong experience working with EHR platforms and large health datasets Excellent understanding of maternal health, NCD, and primary health care indicators Strong analytical writing skills for monthly donor reports Willingness and ability to travel regularly to field locations Skills in Power BI (dashboard design, DAX, data modeling) Responsibilities & Context Shakti Foundation is seeking a results-oriented Manager – Business Data Analyst (Health, EHR & Donor Reporting) to lead health data analysis, dashboard development, and data quality assurance across its Electronic Health Record (EHR)–enabled services. The position will play a central role in analyzing maternal health, non-communicable diseases (NCDs), and primary health care service data, ensuring field-level data accuracy, and producing monthly analytical reports and dashboards for key donors, including Opportunity International Australia (OIA), DFAT, and other institutional partners. This role bridges field operations, digital health systems, and donor accountability, ensuring that program decisions and external reporting are grounded in high-quality, validated data. 1. Health Data Analysis & Insights • Conduct monthly and periodic analysis of health service data, including: ANC, PNC, safe delivery, referrals NCD screening, follow-up, and treatment outcomes Primary health care utilization and service trends • Generate actionable insights to support program performance, service quality improvement, and strategic decision-making 2. EHR Management & Data Quality Assurance Manage and analyze large datasets generated from EHR systems Ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency, and timeliness across SMCCs and Mobile Health Clinics Identify and prevent data duplication, inconsistencies, and reporting errors Lead routine data validation and verification exercises in coordination with program and MIS teams 3. Donor Reporting & Accountability (Monthly) • Prepare monthly analytical reports and dashboards for donors, including OIA, DFAT, and other partners
